# Nima Rasooli

> Rust programmer. Low-level compute enthusiast. Founder of Mirage. Based in Berlin.

## About

Nima Rasooli is a Rust developer specializing in low-level systems programming, blockchain infrastructure, and privacy technology. He is the founder of Mirage, a company making stablecoin privacy accessible and scalable. He writes low-level Rust, builds EVM tooling, and has deep experience in smart contract security and decentralized infrastructure.

## Current Role

- **Founder** at Mirage (2025–present) — stablecoin privacy, Rust, blockchain

## Projects

- **Azoth** — A deterministic EVM bytecode obfuscator written in Rust. https://github.com/mirageprivacy/azoth
- **Liquity Autonomous IR Manager** — An immutable and trustless autonomous interest rate management protocol for Liquity V2. https://github.com/liquity/bold-ir-management
- **DAB** — Collection of on-chain data registries for tokens on the Internet Computer Protocol. https://github.com/psychedelic/dab
- **Non-Fungible Apps** — Trustless onchain access to web3 frontends. https://github.com/fleekxyz/non-fungible-apps

## Work History

- Founder @ Mirage (2025–present)
- EIR @ Code & State (2025)
- Technology Lead @ Code & State (2024–2025)
- Security Researcher @ Solidstate (2023–2025)
- Software Engineer @ Fleek (2021–2024)

## Expertise

Rust, systems programming, EVM, smart contract security, blockchain infrastructure, privacy tech, virtual machines, DeFi, Solidity, WASM
